Question
========

From each of two normally distributed populations with equal variances a sample is drawn.______________. Sample 1: n = 11, mean = 37, sd = 5.78 Sample 2: n = 15, mean = 54, sd = 9.24. The pooled variance estimator takes the value of 63.72. It is tested whether the population averages are equal. The corresponding test size follows, if the null hypothesis is TRUE,

Answerlist
----------

* A T-distribution with 24 degrees of freedom
* An F-division with 10 and 14 degrees of freedom
* An F-division with 11 and 15 degrees of freedom
* A T distribution with 26 degrees of freedom

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* A T-distribution with 24 degrees of freedom: Correct
* An F-division with 10 and 14 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* An F-division with 11 and 15 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* A T-division with 26 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
